title: Why my export report is different from some reports?
content: The unit of the report is indicated at the end of it is in a hundredth: N.B. The figures on this report are in hundredths (1/100) rather than in minutes (1/60)1. Reports in sixtieth (HH: mm)In timesheets, and in the majority if timesheet reports, the unit used is the sixtieth.Examples:1h30min = 01:301h45min = 01:451h15min = 01:15To calculate hundredths in minutes: take the digits after the decimal point x 60 (min).Example: 1.8 = 1h + (0.8 x 60min) = 1h + 48minReports that use the sixtieth unit: Batch timesheet & timesheet reportIndividual & individual summary in batchOvertime Punches per employeeModified punches per EmployeeTimebankBanks summaryReal hours summaryHours worked summary (Reports-Costs)2. Reports in hundredths (HH.mm)In the pay exportation report, the unit used is the hundredth.Exemples:1h30min = 1.5h1h45min = 1.75h1h15min = 1.25hTo calculate sixtieths in hundredths: take the minutes and divide them by 60 (min). Example: 1h + 36 min / 60 = 1.6hReports that use the hundredth unit:Export reportPay summaryDaily summaryInter-DivisionTrainingHelpful?00Updated: 4 years ago Share :
